meanings.definition: A soft slipper typically worn indoors.
meanings.sent1: She slipped on her cozy pantoffle before curling up on the couch.
meanings.sent2: I always keep my pantoffle by the bed to wear in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat mistook my pantoffle for a toy and batted it around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her worn-out pantoffle was like a faithful companion, always there for her.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy pink pantoffle felt like a cloud hugging my feet.

meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she loves to pantoffle around the house.
meanings.sent2: He pantoffles quietly so as not to wake anyone up.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched their dad pantoffle clumsily on the wooden floor.
meanings.sent4: She pantoffled her way to the kitchen, craving a midnight snack.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pantoffling echoed through the quiet house.
